message_1: What is the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $5^n\equiv 1\pmod{13}$?
message_2:
We want to find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $5^n \equiv 1 \pmod{13}$. We can start by calculating the powers of $5$ modulo $13$:

$5^1 \equiv 5 \pmod{13}$

$5^2 \equiv 25 \equiv 12 \pmod{13}$

$5^3 \equiv 5 \cdot 12 \equiv 60 \equiv 8 \pmod{13}$

$5^4 \equiv 5 \cdot 8 \equiv 40 \equiv 1 \pmod{13}$

We found that $5^4 \equiv 1 \pmod{13}$, so the smallest positive integer $n$ is $\boxed{4}$.
